    • Method Detail

      • getHemisphere

        public static int getHemisphere​(GeoPoint gp)
        Given a GeoPoint return an integer that describes it is in HEMISPHERE_WEST or HEMISPHERE_EAST.
        Parameters:
        gp - the GeoPoint to test
        Returns:
        the integer describing which hemisphere.

      • wrapLongitude

        public static GeoPoint wrapLongitude​(GeoPoint gp,
                                     int toHemi)
        Given a GeoPoint return a GeoPoint that is wrapped to the appropriate hemisphere.
        Parameters:
        gp - a GeoPoint
        toHemi - the integer flag designating HEMISPHERE_WEST or HEMISPHERE_EAST
        Returns:
        the GeoPoint with the longitude wrapped to the correct hemisphere, more positive is east and more negative is west.

      • wrapLongitude

        public static double wrapLongitude​(double longitude)
        Parameters:
        longitude -
        Returns:

      • findIntersection

        public static GeoPoint findIntersection​(GeoPoint start0,
                                        GeoPoint end0,
                                        GeoPoint start1,
                                        GeoPoint end1)
        Given two lines described by points {start0, end0} and {start1, end1}, find the intersection
        Parameters:
        start0 - the start point of line 0
        end0 - the end point of line 0
        start1 - the start point of line 1
        end1 - the end point of line 1
        Returns:
        return the geopoint formed by the intersection of these lines

                                         GeoPoint b,
                                         boolean wrap180)
        Deternine the midpoint between two points in carteasian space
        Parameters:
        a - the first point
        b - the second point
        wrap180 - if the longitude should be wrapped to be within -180 to 180
        Returns:
        the carteasian center point

      • findExtremes

        public static int[] findExtremes​(GeoPoint[] points,
                                 int offset,
                                 int count)

      • findExtremes

        public static int[] findExtremes​(GeoPoint[] points,
                                 int offset,
                                 int count,
                                 boolean wrap180)
        GIven an array of points, find the outer most extremes
        Parameters:
        points - the array of points
        offset - the offset into the array of points
        count - the number of points from the offset to consider
        wrap180 - if it is intended that these points will consider wrapping the IDL (continuous scrolling)
        Returns:
        the index of the 4 points that define the extremes of the array of points {W, N, E, S}

      • findExtremes

        public static int[] findExtremes​(GeoPointMetaData[] points,
                                 int offset,
                                 int count,
                                 boolean wrap180)
        GIven an array of points, find the outer most extremes
        Parameters:
        points - the array of points
        offset - the offset into the array of points
        count - the number of points from the offset to consider
        wrap180 - if it is intended that these points will consider wrapping the IDL (continuous scrolling)
        Returns:
        the index of the 4 points that define the extremes of the array of points {W, N, E, S}

      • pointAtDistance

        @Deprecated
@DeprecatedApi(since="4.7",
               removeAt="5.0")
public static GeoPoint pointAtDistance​(GeoPoint src,
                                       double azimuth,
                                       double distance)
        Deprecated.
        GeoCalculations.pointAtDistance(IGeoPoint, IGeoPoint, double)
        Calculates a new GeoPoint at the given azimuth and distance away from the source point
        Parameters:
        src - the source point
        azimuth - Azimuth in degrees True North
        distance - Meters
        Returns:
        the point computed based on the src, azimuth and distance

      • pointAtDistance

        @Deprecated
@DeprecatedApi(since="4.7",
               removeAt="5.0")
public static GeoPoint pointAtDistance​(GeoPoint src,
                                       double azimuth,
                                       double distance,
                                       double inclination)
        Deprecated.
        GeoCalculations.pointAtDistance(IGeoPoint, IGeoPoint, double)
        Computes the destination point from the starting point, given an azimuth and distance in the direction of the destination point.

        The distance parameter ALWAYS represents surface distance, whether or not the inclination is NAN. This means that for computing slant points, distance does not equal the slant range.

        Parameters:
        src - Starting point of the calculation.
        azimuth - Azimuth in degrees (True North)
        distance - Surface distance between the start and destination point in meters
        inclination - from start point, NAN for surface only computation
        Returns:
        Destination point, if the point is antipodal from the starting point then the calculation could be off. Attempts to calculate the altitude from inclination.

      • pointAtDistance

        @Deprecated
@DeprecatedApi(since="4.7",
               removeAt="5.0")
public static GeoPoint pointAtDistance​(GeoPoint src,
                                       GeoPoint dst,
                                       double weight)
        Deprecated.
        GeoCalculations.pointAtDistance(IGeoPoint, IGeoPoint, double)
        Computes the destination point from the starting point, given an azimuth and distance in the direction of the destination point.

        The distance parameter ALWAYS represents surface distance, whether or not the inclination is NAN. This means that for computing slant points, distance does not equal the slant range.

        Parameters:
        src - Starting point of the calculation.
        dst - Destination point of the calculation.
        Returns:
        Destination point, if the point is antipodal from the starting point then the calculation could be off. Attempts to calculate the altitude from inclination.

      • lineOfBearingIntersect

        @Deprecated
@DeprecatedApi(since="4.7",
               removeAt="5.0")
public static GeoPoint lineOfBearingIntersect​(GeoPoint start1,
                                              GeoPoint end1,
                                              GeoPoint start2,
                                              GeoPoint end2)
        Deprecated.
        GeoCalculations.lineOfBearingIntersect(IGeoPoint, double, IGeoPoint, double)
        Returns the intersection given two lines of bearing
        Parameters:
        start1 - The start point of the first line of bearing
        end1 - The end point of the first line of bearing
        start2 - The start point of the second line of bearing
        end2 - The end point of the second line of bearing
        Returns:
        The intersection of the two lines of bearing, or null if there is no intersection

      • lineOfBearingIntersect

        @Deprecated
@DeprecatedApi(since="4.7",
               removeAt="5.0")
public static GeoPoint lineOfBearingIntersect​(GeoPoint aStart,
                                              double aBearing,
                                              GeoPoint bStart,
                                              double bBearing)
        Deprecated.
        GeoCalculations.lineOfBearingIntersect(IGeoPoint, double, IGeoPoint, double)
        Returns the intersection given two lines of bearing
        Parameters:
        aStart - The start point of the first line of bearing
        aBearing - The bearing of the first line of bearing
        bStart - The start point of the second line of bearing
        bBearing - The bearing of the second line of bearing
        Returns:
        The intersection of the two lines of bearing, or null if there is no intersection
